channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 一对夫妇花了很长时间才把一栋破旧的楼房改造成了拥有两间卧室和两间浴室的住宅。等待是值得的。
item.description:
A couple played the long game while transforming a dilapidated building into a two-bedroom, two-bathroom home. It was worth the wait. https://t.co/Q1Qg79se73 https://t.co/Q1Qg79se73

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 15, 2024

item.title: 哈佛大学对行为科学家弗朗西斯卡-吉诺（Francesca Gino）进行了调查，发现她的工作中包含被操纵的数据。
item.description:
A Harvard University probe into behavioral scientist Francesca Gino, known for her research into the reasons people lie and cheat, found that her work contained manipulated data https://t.co/u2irhUIl2P https://t.co/u2irhUIl2P

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 15, 2024

item.title: 在比佛利山庄，一座占地约 2.8 万平方英尺的别墅即将以 8500 万美元的价格上市。该别墅被称为 Theos 别墅，其设施堪比主题公园：保龄球馆、夜总会、射击场，甚至还有一个逃生隧道。
item.description:
In Beverly Hills, a roughly 28,000-square-foot compound is coming on the market for $85 million. Known as Villa Theos, it has amenities worthy of a theme park: a bowling alley, nightclub, shooting range, and even an escape tunnel https://t.co/6u3FwurnLO https://t.co/6u3FwurnLO

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 超级通勤者需要大量的金钱、里程数和耐力。以下是《华尔街日报》的一位记者如何从俄亥俄州的家中前往纽约工作。
item.description:
Being a supercommuter takes a lot of money, miles and stamina. Here's how a WSJ reporter has been traveling to work in New York City from his home in Ohio. https://t.co/SpOa7Vcmfc https://t.co/SpOa7Vcmfc

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 独生子女越来越普遍。当父母年老时，他们可能会面临沉重的负担。
item.description:
Only children are becoming more common. They can face a heavy load when parents get older. https://t.co/ZsqHoprzJo https://t.co/ZsqHoprzJo

item.title: 您愿意花 65 美元购买香奈儿除臭剂吗？我们试用了 4 款名牌止汗剂，看看它们是否胜过药店的主打产品
item.description:

item.title: 影评在《爱丽丝与杰克》（Alice & Jack）中，安德里亚-里斯博罗（Andrea Riseborough）和多姆纳尔-格里森（Domhnall Gleeson）上演了一段跨越相聚、分离和重逢的六段式浪漫爱情。
item.description:
Review: In "Alice & Jack," Andrea Riseborough and Domhnall Gleeson mesmerize in a six-part romance that spans periods of togetherness, separation and reunion https://t.co/t0Nfuiqbmw https://t.co/t0Nfuiqbmw

item.title: 拉塔姆航空公司一架波音 787 客机突然坠毁，驾驶舱座椅发生事故，可能将一名飞行员推入控制室，导致一些乘客被压在天花板上。
item.description:
A cockpit seat mishap may have pushed a pilot into the controls on the Latam Boeing 787 that took a sudden plunge and pinned some passengers to the ceiling https://t.co/vpIJv79wjw https://t.co/vpIJv79wjw

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: "三明治穿衣法 "与蛋黄酱无关，它是一种快速穿衣的时尚策略。以下是一些时尚女性的穿衣之道。
item.description:
"Sandwich dressing" isn't about mayo—it's a fashion strategy for getting dressed fast, and very well. Here's how some very stylish women do it. https://t.co/R3JaGxAJQU https://t.co/R3JaGxAJQU

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：当政客们告诉我们必须 "遵循科学 "来制定极端的气候政策时，他们实际上是在试图阻止我们讨论巨大的、不可持续的成本。我们不应该让他们得逞，@BjornLomborg 写道。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: When politicians tell us we must “follow the science” toward extreme climate policies, they are really trying to shut down the discussion of enormous, unsustainable costs. We shouldn’t let them, writes @BjornLomborg. https://t.co/V47WJaTUnU

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 从月光酒到葡萄酒庄更年长、更富裕的人口涌入阿巴拉契亚，把一个乡村地区变成了热闹的退休天堂。
item.description:
From moonshine to wineries. An older, wealthier population is flooding into Appalachia, transforming a rustic region into a bustling retirement haven. https://t.co/eRxihqvSSa https://t.co/eRxihqvSSa

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：唐纳德-格雷厄姆（Donald E. Graham）写道：将股市收益和亏损视为收益，即使不是毫无意义，也会使任何公司的业绩变得混乱不堪
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: Treating stock-market gains and losses as earnings makes any corporation’s results confusing if not meaningless, writes Donald E. Graham https://t.co/tuLzUw810n https://t.co/tuLzUw810n

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 一个多世纪以来，社会一直认为反社会病症是不可治疗和不可救赎的。经过多年的研究和治疗，我可以说反社会者并不 "坏"、"邪恶 "或 "疯狂"。我们的行为是为了填补空虚，帕特里克-加涅写道。
item.description:
For more than a century, society has deemed sociopathy untreatable and unredeemable. After years of study and therapy, I can say that sociopaths aren’t “bad” or “evil” or “crazy.” We act out to fill a void, writes Patric Gagne. https://t.co/ir9YznyW2A https://t.co/ir9YznyW2A

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：在国情咨文中，拜登在我国的关键时刻毫无必要地侮辱、诱导和冒犯了重要的政治人物，在贬低他们的同时也贬低了自己。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: In his State of the Union address, Biden needlessly insulted, baited and offended important political players at a critical moment for our country, diminishing himself as he belittled them, writes @KarlRove https://t.co/8NVRbvPJpP https://t.co/8NVRbvPJpP

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 最近几周，黄金价格飙升至历史新高。现在，投资者面临的问题是，价格上涨能否持续。
item.description:
Gold prices have surged to record highs in recent weeks. Now, the question for investors is whether rising prices can persist. https://t.co/TIVfcztBlP https://t.co/TIVfcztBlP

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 语言课、鹦鹉邂逅、水球大战--这些都是豪华度假村儿童俱乐部中孩子们的必修课。
item.description:
Language lessons, parakeet encounters and water-balloon fights—they're all part of the experience for children dropping into kids clubs at luxury resorts https://t.co/jSPVgL1mi5 https://t.co/jSPVgL1mi5

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：今年的总统选举，美国公众需要的是一场有理有据的选举。相反，法律机会主义可能会投下最大的一票，@DanHenninger 写道。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: The American public needed a presidential election this year on the merits. Instead, legal opportunism may cast the biggest vote, writes @DanHenninger. https://t.co/ntH88QXOFb https://t.co/ntH88QXOFb

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 黑客会不会通过在训练数据中下毒，让生成式人工智能工具干坏事？一些研究人员认为会。
item.description:
Could hackers get generative AI tools to do something bad by poisoning their training data? Some researchers think so. https://t.co/MIBgq1sIna https://t.co/MIBgq1sIna

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：拜登政府是时候认清现实了：绝大多数巴勒斯坦人支持谋杀犹太人，而以色列人认为巴勒斯坦人不配拥有一个国家，@amitsegal22 写道。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: It’s time the Biden Administration recognizes reality: The Palestinians overwhelmingly support the murder of Jews, and the Israelis don’t think the Palestinians deserve a state, writes @amitsegal22 https://t.co/M703OnvO9a https://t.co/M703OnvO9a

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 治疗师在你哭泣时对你竖起的大拇指。气球打断公司董事会。这是苹果一项引发混乱的功能的一部分。

item.title: 1967 年，根岸重一（Shigeichi Negishi）在自弹自唱时，他的一位员工告诉他，他唱得并不好。于是，卡拉 OK 机诞生了。
item.description:
In 1967, Shigeichi Negishi was singing to himself when one of his employees told him that he wasn’t a very good singer. The karaoke machine was born. https://t.co/kMyq9HXBCg https://t.co/kMyq9HXBCg

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.description:

item.title: Apollo、Blackstone 和 KKR 等私人基金管理公司正大举进军资产借贷领域，目标直指全球经济的最大赢家--美国消费者。

item.title: 华尔街日报》随美国空军飞越加沙，运送援助物资，帮助巴勒斯坦人应对人道主义灾难

item.title: 以色列军方表示将与美国合作建立一条海上走廊，以便向加沙北部 "大量 "输送援助物资，因为国际社会就饥饿危机对以色列施加的压力越来越大
item.description:
The Israeli military said it would work with the U.S. to set up a sea corridor in an effort to “flood” northern Gaza with aid as international pressure grows on Israel over the hunger crisis https://t.co/98ftSRJKMb https://t.co/98ftSRJKMb

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：TikTok 动员其约 1.7 亿美国用户大军游说国会，反对要求出售 TikTok 的法案。这一噱头可能适得其反。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: TikTok mobilized its army of some 170 million American users to lobby Congress against a bill to require its sale. The stunt may have backfired. https://t.co/WkRgQVtIdW https://t.co/WkRgQVtIdW

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024

item.title: 奥克兰运动家队（Oakland A's）发布了拟在拉斯维加斯建造的新主场的效果图，但关于在此期间的活动和比赛地点的计划细节却少得令人吃惊。
item.description:
The Oakland A’s released renderings for its proposed new home in Las Vegas, but plans for what to do and where to play in the interim are surprisingly light on details https://t.co/id1B7EeXv0 https://t.co/id1B7EeXv0

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 14, 2024
